body.p: Context hintscontext hints are yellow and green tags with frames that tell you where elements close to the position of the cursor start and end.

li.p: A green rectangular tag shows the cursor is inside an element.

fig.title: The cursor is in the <cmd> element.

li.p: A yellow opening tag shows the cursor is before an element.

fig.title: The cursor is before the <cmd> element.

li.p: A yellow closing tag shows the cursor is after an element.

fig.title: The cursor is after the <cmd> element.

li.p: Two yellow tags show the cursor is between two elements.

fig.title: The cursor is between the <context> and the <steps> elements.

p.b: Inside a parent element, before/after a child element

li.p: When you place the cursor inside an element that has child elements and the cursor doesn't immediately precede or follow any of them, yellow context hints appear to show the beginning and the end of the nearest child element that goes before or after the cursor, or both.

fig.title: The cursor is in the <para> parent element; the yellow tag shows the <cmd> child element.

li.p: In such cases, you can also set the green tag and the frame of the parent element to be shown.

fig.title: The cursor is in the <para> parent element; the tags show the <para> parent element and the <cmd> child element.

body.p:
Context hints can last for a couple of seconds or be persistent:
Persistent
Context hints set to be persistent will last until you change the cursor position.
Temporary
Context hints set to be temporary will last for specific time that you specify and then disappear.
Disabled
When disabled, context hints won't show.
For instructions on how to set the behaviour of context hints, see .
